instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: When this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> get low to 40% will suspend or shutdown. Battery problem? SMC problem? Something to check first?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: Battery. So many of these batteries are crap. Don't bother getting a "new" one as the Chinese just take a crap battery and reset the cycle count and charge capacity. Usually the shutting down at 20-30% are the Chinese ones because the charge capacity was reset.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: With any program is possible to check that? Or they clear all parameters?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: Nope, this is a battery issue and I bet it is already one of those chinese batteries. See if it is stuck in the case really good, the chinese ones usually flop around as the tape is crap.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: Yes, it is chines one. I bought it as "new"

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: Garbage battery, good luck finding something that works......hopeless.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message:
I recived another battery that work 5 hours from 100 to 0% and it shotdown at 0%. Not before.
So can I considere this battery is good? Should I try anything else?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: It should not shut down but go to sleep. But this is better than nothing so just leave it. These batteries are hopeless.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: If chines recicly batteries then they can take batteries wih 100 cycles and reset them and they can take ones with 800 cycles. With coconut it it impossible to check any parameter and see if battery will be good? If this battery had 100 cycles it will be like new. But how to know that?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message:
Chinese know exactly what batteries they are selling and they are NOT giving the good ones to you.

We can only wait until the supply of pulled garbage batteries dries up and someone HAS to make something new. Just don't have many hopes. 

I got 9 batteries today and the first one reported the fake 8700mAh capacity. It then shut down at 18% charge and the charge capacity dropped to 7300mAH. HOPELESS GARBAGE everywhere....just forget about replacing batteries that still work but just have a bit lower capacity.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: I will try new one from another supplier and will test this week.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: Good luck with that. I'm done with these.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: Will try an tell you. It is provider that tells me it is 100% new and hight quality. What problems can I except? So I can test it well? After that will inform.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message:
Of course they will say it is 100% new. These sellers have no idea what they are really selling.

Just run the battery till empty and watch it shut down at 20% or so. A few really deep discharger/recharge cycles may bring the full charge capacity closer to reality and make the shut down issue less of a problem.

Just look at the charge capacity and voltage. I have batteries here that are reporting to have 2000mAh and the voltage is at 9.5V, total bull shit of course. Charge capacity should be 0mAh at around 10.5V, that is in the ball park of normal.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: If coconut tells 90% could be bad battery also? Did you have such case? Or 90% will be good in most cases?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: You cannot tell as the Full Charge Capacity has been reset by your Chinese friends. Run it down till empty and see when it shuts down

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: Well coocnut says design capacity that chines reset and real capacity. Real capacity is measured in the moment, right?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 shutdown at 40% battery discharged
threads.message: The whole thing is messed up because no calibration cycles were done after the reset. If they would do that it the capacity would fall back to probably 70%. Also the cells need to do an impedance balancing, there is too much to this to explain here.
